definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: Apparently, the enzymes in the Civet’s stomach remove some of the bitter coffee taste.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，麝香貓胃裏的酶提純了咖啡的苦味。

sentences.english: He grimaced at the bitter taste.
sentences.chinese: 他一嘗那苦味，做了個怪相。

sentences.english: Bitterness is often a sign of a mild rancidity.
sentences.chinese: 苦味通常就是有輕微的腐爛。

sentences.english: Naringin and Limonin are the main bitter compounds of the citrus fruit juices.
sentences.chinese: 檸鹼和柚苷是柑桔汁及柑桔其它製品中主要苦味成份。

sentences.english: If you put picric acid solution on a burn it will take the pain away at once.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把苦味酸溶液塗在燒傷處可立即止痛。

sentences.english: If you prefer mid-days, summer, heat, bitter flavors and the color of red.
sentences.chinese: 如果您喜歡中午，夏天，熱，苦味和紅色的顏色。

sentences.english: A bitter alkaloid poison resembling strychnine and extracted from nux vomica.
sentences.chinese: 一種類似馬錢子鹼的苦味生物鹼毒藥，從馬錢子提取。

sentences.english: In this respect it resembles picric acid .
sentences.chinese: 在這方面它類似於苦味酸。

sentences.english: The sting and throat eye without bitterness, more comfortable natural swear.
sentences.chinese: 眼無刺痛，喉無干苦味，更具舒適自然。

sentences.english: The bud may have a bitt er taste, but sweet will be the flower.
sentences.chinese: 蓓蕾也許有苦味，可花朵卻是甜蜜的。

sentences.english: Limonin and Naringin are the main bitter substances of citrus juice and other citrus's products.
sentences.chinese: 檸鹼和柚苷是柑桔汁及柑桔其它製品中主要苦味成份。

sentences.english: Bohemians also burn sugar into their absinthe to mellow its bitter anise flavour.
sentences.chinese: 波希米亞人也將糖放入苦艾酒中以減少茴香的苦味。

sentences.english: Due to some bitterness eat food, such as bitter gourd .
sentences.chinese: 要適當多喫一些苦味的食物，如苦瓜等。

sentences.english: The whey poly-peptides drinks obtained were free of bitters and had good stability.
sentences.chinese: 所研製的乳清多肽飲料無苦味，且具有良好的穩定性。

sentences.english: Bake big batches of bitter brown bread.
sentences.chinese: 烘烤大批的苦味黑麪包。

definition: taste/texture (of food)/how food feels in the mouth
